result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight Turner Jr

defendant.name: Turner, Dwight, Jr
defendant.address: 411 East Centennial Drive, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight Turner Jr in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin. Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dwight Turner Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court in person for Dwight Turner Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 080684,
Payable Number: 1027636,
Receipt Number: 22RP033945,
Amount: $20.00
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mary LT.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Dwight Turner in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Dwight Turner in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dwight Turner appeared by video means with Attorney. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
